Detailed Description

This is an iterator that interpolates between set values. Users append entries of from-value to-value and num-steps. The iterator will then provide iteratation over those ranges.
Author:
Zeke McKinney

Definition at line 46 of file InterpolatorIterator.h.

This defines a linear segment to append to this iterator.

Note:
This interface makes discontinuities possible.
Todo:
Perhaps for future versions: void append(const InterpolatorIterator&);

t_to The end time
v_from The beginning value
v_to The ending value

virtual m_value_type& InterpolatorIterator::next (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Returns the next value in the iteration.

Note:
Because this returns a reference type, value_ can be changed by the caller. Steps should be taken to prevent this (with a pass-to-caller member variable perhaps)

Implements AbstractIterator< m_value_type >.

Implemented in LinearInterpolatorIterator, ExponentialInterpolatorIterator, and CubicSplineInterpolatorIterator.
